Nonforfeiture Benefit.value: Nonforfeiture Rider / Contingent Benefit Upon Lapse: provides some benefits if policy lapses for nonpayment or is cancelled; rider must be in effect for 3 years to apply; provides full MBA and reduced TBA equal to greater of total premiums paid or 1x MBA; contingent benefit gives limited coverage if policy ends for non-payment or cancellation after premium increase

sources.snippet: Provides some benefits if policy lapses for nonpayment of premiums or is cancelled by insured; Rider must be in effect for 3 years and be in effect when the policy ends; Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of: the total amount of premium paid; or 1x MBA; Available at initial application only

Contingent Benefit Upon Lapse — Limited coverage provided if policy ends due to non-payment of premiums or insured's written request to cancel following a substantial premium increase; Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of: the total amount of premium paid or 1x MBA

Premium Payment Options.value: Standard Pay: Annual, Semi-Annual, Quarterly, Monthly (EFT); 10 Year Premium Payment Rider available at initial application only; N/A with FPO or GPO; may impact tax deductibility

sources.snippet: Standard Pay: Annual, Semi-Annual, Quarterly, Monthly (EFT); 10 Year Premium Payment Rider – available at initial application only; N/A with FPO or GPO; May impact the tax deductibility of the premium; The client should consult a tax advisor for further clarification
Payment Options — Standard Pay: Annual, Semi-Annual, Quarterly, Monthly (EFT); 10 Year Premium Payment Rider available at initial application only; may impact tax deductibility; consult tax advisor

Return/Refund of Premium.value: If insured dies on or before his/her 70th birthday, 100% of premiums paid, minus any benefits paid or payable, will be returned to insured's beneficiary or estate

sources.snippet: If insured dies on or before his/her 70th birthday, 100% of premiums paid, minus any benefits paid or payable, will be returned to insured's beneficiary or estate
Return of Premium — If insured dies on or before his/her 70th birthday, 100% of premiums paid, minus any benefits paid or payable, will be returned...

Compound Inflation.value: Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Rider available (3% or 5%) — increases MBA and remaining TBA annually (compound) with no corresponding increase in premium; variants: 3% and 5%

sources.snippet: Increases the MBA and remaining portion of the TBA in effect at the end of the previous policy year, either 3% or 5%, with no corresponding increase in premium; Coverage increases continue while insured is eligible for benefits; Rider available at any time...
Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Riders - Increases the MBA and remaining portion of the TBA ... 3% or 5% variants

Waiver of Premium.value: Premiums waived when EP is satisfied and the insured is receiving payment of benefits

Premium Waiver — Premiums waived when EP is satisfied and the insured is receiving payment of benefits

Survivorship.value: Shared Care Rider: when insured dies, remaining TBA under his/her policy is transferred to spouse's/partner's policy at no extra cost

sources.snippet: When insured dies, remaining TBA under his/her policy is transferred to the spouse's/partner's policy at no extra cost

Guaranteed Purchase Option.value: GPO (included with Simple Advantage only): Insured can purchase additional coverage every 3 years up to age 65 with no additional underwriting; lifetime maximum increase is 2x initial TBA and MBA; minimum 25% of initial coverage must be purchased each time; ends at policy anniversary after insured's 65th birthday or when ineligible

sources.snippet: Insured able to purchase additional coverage every 3 years, up to age 65, with no additional underwriting; ... Lifetime maximum increase available is 2x initial TBA and 2x initial MBA; Minimum of 25% of initial coverage must be purchased each time GPO is exercised...
GUARANTEED PURCHASE OPTION (GPO) (INCLUDED WITH SIMPLE ADVANTAGE ONLY)

Indemnity Benefit.value: Cash Benefit Rider: Full MBA paid as cash payment regardless of actual charges (i.e., indemnity-style); available at initial application only; $1MM TBA not available when Cash Benefit Rider selected

sources.snippet: Full MBA paid as cash payment (regardless of actual charges incurred) instead of reimbursement for covered services; Available at initial application only; $1MM TBA not available

reasoningNotes: Populated only fields with explicit evidence in the extraction JSON. Fields with no specific mention were set to null per rule.
Elimination Period fields mapped directly from the explicit '100 Calendar Days; Once per lifetime and cumulative' entry (high confidence).
Bed reservation mapped to facility bed reservation text (50 days per calendar year), and amount recorded as 'actual charges incurred' since that phrasing appears in the source.

MBA/TBA maxima derived from table examples. These are examples in the doc (e.g., $15K and TBAs up to $1MM); confidence is medium since the table lists multiple options and rider constraints (Cash Benefit Rider excludes $1MM).
Nonforfeiture/Contingent Benefit information combined from Nonforfeiture Rider summary (page 1) and Contingent Benefit Upon Lapse (page 2).
Care coordination, home care, homemaker, adult day care, hospice and facility care were populated from 'Home and Community Care' and 'Facility Care' descriptions (medium confidence).

Inflation protection populated under 'Compound Inflation' because the document explicitly references Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Riders (3%/5%); no explicit 'simple inflation' option was provided, so Simple Inflation was left null.
Where multiple related fields exist (e.g., Return/Refund of Premium and Premium Refund at Death), the same explicit source was used for both fields.
Two 'Additional Benefits' fields were left null because no other ad hoc additional benefit descriptions were present in the provided extraction.
All populated entries include source references (page and fieldId/tableId) and use confidence scores matching the extraction confidences (0.8 for high-confidence fields, 0.6 for medium).
